description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家、军事家，中华民国开国元勋。辛亥革命时期，与孙中山常被时人以“孙黄”并称。他是华兴会的创始人，也是中国同盟会的创建者之一。
description.en: A Chinese modern democratic revolutionary, military leader, and a founding father of the Republic of China. During the Xinhai Revolution period, he and Sun Yat-sen were often referred to as 'Sun-Huang'. He was the founder of the Huaxing Society and one of the creators of the Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命的伟大先行者，中华民国开国元勋。与黄兴在辛亥革命时期并称“孙黄”，被公推为中国同盟会总理。
description.en: A great pioneer of modern Chinese democratic revolution and a founding father of the Republic of China. He and Huang Xing were known as 'Sun-Huang' during the Xinhai Revolution period and was elected as the Premier of the Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 由黄兴于1904年在湖南长沙创立的革命团体，以“驱逐鞑虏，复兴中华”为口号，后与其他革命团体合并成立中国同盟会。
description.en: A revolutionary group founded by Huang Xing in Changsha, Hunan, in 1904, with the slogan 'Expel the Tartar barbarians and revive China'. It later merged with other revolutionary groups to form the Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 由兴中会、华兴会、光复会等革命团体于1905年在日本东京合并成立的革命政党，公推孙中山为总理，黄兴任执行部庶务。
description.en: A revolutionary political party formed in Tokyo, Japan, in 1905 through the merger of revolutionary groups such as the Xingzhonghui, Huaxinghui, and Guangfuhui. Sun Yat-sen was elected Premier, and Huang Xing served as the head of the executive department.

description.zh-cn: 1911年由中国同盟会在广州发动的一场旨在推翻清朝的武装起义，由赵声任总指挥，黄兴任副总指挥并亲率敢死队。起义虽失败，但极大地震撼了清朝统治。
description.en: An armed uprising launched by the Tongmenghui in Guangzhou in 1911 to overthrow the Qing dynasty. Zhao Sheng was the commander-in-chief, and Huang Xing was the deputy commander, personally leading the dare-to-die squad. Although the uprising failed, it greatly shook the Qing rule.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代革命家，黄兴的第二任妻子。她在黄花岗起义失败后，曾护送受伤的黄兴至香港就医。
description.en: A modern Chinese revolutionary and the second wife of Huang Xing. After the failure of the Second Guangzhou Uprising, she escorted the injured Huang Xing to Hong Kong for medical treatment.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国第一任正式大总统，后称帝，其行为引发了护国战争。宋教仁案后，孙中山、黄兴等人发动二次革命讨伐他。
description.en: The first formal President of the Republic of China, who later proclaimed himself emperor, leading to the National Protection War. After the Song Jiaoren assassination case, Sun Yat-sen, Huang Xing, and others launched the Second Revolution against him.

description.zh-cn: 1913年因宋教仁案而爆发的一场由国民党人领导的，旨在反对袁世凯独裁统治的武装革命。黄兴任江苏讨袁军总司令。
description.en: An armed revolution led by the Kuomintang in 1913, triggered by the assassination of Song Jiaoren, aimed at opposing Yuan Shikai's autocratic rule. Huang Xing served as the commander-in-chief of the Jiangsu anti-Yuan army.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代革命家，华兴会和同盟会的主要成员，国民党的筹建人之一。1913年被暗杀，引发二次革命。
description.en: A modern Chinese revolutionary, a key member of the Huaxing Society and the Tongmenghui, and one of the main founders of the Kuomintang. His assassination in 1913 triggered the Second Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 清末的一个革命团体，1905年并入中国同盟会，后因与孙中山产生分歧而退出。
description.en: A revolutionary organization in the late Qing dynasty. It merged into the Tongmenghui in 1905 but later withdrew due to disagreements with Sun Yat-sen.

description.zh-cn: 由孙中山于1894年创立的中国近代第一个革命团体，后与其他革命团体合并成立中国同盟会。
description.en: The first modern Chinese revolutionary group, founded by Sun Yat-sen in 1894. It later merged with other revolutionary groups to form the Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 光复会领导人之一。因反对孙中山，要求改选同盟会总理，后被陈其美派蒋介石刺杀。
description.en: One of the leaders of the Guangfuhui. He opposed Sun Yat-sen and demanded a re-election for the premier of the Tongmenghui. He was later assassinated by Chiang Kai-shek under the orders of Chen Qimei.

description.zh-cn: 中国同盟会元老，中华民国早期政治人物。他派遣蒋介石刺杀了光复会领袖陶成章。
description.en: A veteran of the Tongmenghui and an early political figure in the Republic of China. He dispatched Chiang Kai-shek to assassinate Guangfuhui leader Tao Chengzhang.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家及军事家，曾任中华民国总统。在陈其美的派遣下，执行了对陶成章的刺杀。
description.en: A statesman and military leader of the Republic of China, who served as President of the ROC. Under the orders of Chen Qimei, he carried out the assassination of Tao Chengzhang.

description.zh-cn: 指光复会领袖陶成章在上海广慈医院被刺杀的事件，由陈其美策划，蒋介石执行。
description.en: Refers to the assassination of Guangfuhui leader Tao Chengzhang at Guangci Hospital in Shanghai, planned by Chen Qimei and carried out by Chiang Kai-shek.

description.zh-cn: 辛亥革命的开端，此事件的成功发动，导致中国各地纷纷响应，最终推翻了清朝统治。起义爆发后，黄兴赶赴前线被推为战时总司令。
description.en: The beginning of the Xinhai Revolution. Its successful launch led to responses across China, ultimately overthrowing the Qing dynasty. After the uprising, Huang Xing went to the front line and was appointed commander-in-chief.

description.zh-cn: 晚清名臣、洋务派代表人物，曾任湖广总督。他曾推荐黄兴入武昌两湖书院读书。
description.en: A prominent official of the late Qing dynasty and a representative of the Self-Strengthening Movement, who served as the Viceroy of Huguang. He recommended Huang Xing to study at the Lianghu Academy in Wuchang.

description.zh-cn: 位于武昌的著名书院，由张之洞创办，黄兴曾在此就读。
description.en: A famous academy in Wuchang, founded by Zhang Zhidong, where Huang Xing once studied.

description.zh-cn: 位于日本东京的一所学校，为中国留学生提供教育。黄兴曾在此留学。
description.en: A school in Tokyo, Japan, that provided education for Chinese students. Huang Xing studied here.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国初年军事家，护国战争的主要组织者和领导者。他与黄兴是同乡和友人，为黄兴写下挽联，后亦同葬于岳麓山。
description.en: A military leader in the early Republic of China, and a key organizer and leader of the National Protection War. He was a fellow townsman and friend of Huang Xing, wrote a funeral couplet for him, and was later buried alongside him on Yuelu Mountain.

description.zh-cn: 清代湖南省长沙府下辖的一个县，是黄兴的出生地。今为长沙市长沙县的一部分。
description.en: A county under Changsha Prefecture in Hunan Province during the Qing dynasty, and the birthplace of Huang Xing. It is now part of Changsha County, Changsha City.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国时期江苏省下辖的一个县，是黄兴的逝世地。今为上海市的一部分。
description.en: A county under Jiangsu Province during the Republic of China era, and the place where Huang Xing died. It is now part of Shanghai Municipality.

description.zh-cn: 晚清秀才，黄兴的父亲。
description.en: A scholar of the late Qing dynasty (Xiucai) and the father of Huang Xing.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴的第一任妻子。
description.en: The first wife of Huang Xing.

en: Military Government of the Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 武昌起义后成立的革命政权。黄兴曾被推举为该政府的战时总司令。
description.en: A revolutionary government established after the Wuchang Uprising. Huang Xing was appointed as its wartime commander-in-chief.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴于1874年10月25日出生于湖南省长沙府善化县。
description.en: Huang Xing was born in Shanhua County, Changsha Prefecture, Hunan Province on October 25, 1874.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴于1916年10月31日在上海病逝。由于规则没有定义DEATH_IN关系，使用INFLUENCED表示其逝世地点。
description.en: Huang Xing passed away in Shanghai on October 31, 1916. As there is no DEATH_IN relationship defined in the rules, INFLUENCED is used to denote his place of death.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴是黄筱村的儿子。
description.en: Huang Xing is the son of Huang Xiaocun.

description.zh-cn: 廖淡如是黄兴的第一任妻子（大房）。
description.en: Liao Danru was Huang Xing's first wife.

description.zh-cn: 徐宗汉是黄兴的第二任妻子（二房）。她在黄花岗起义失败后照顾受伤的黄兴，并以其夫人名义在手术同意书上签字。
description.en: Xu Zonghan was Huang Xing's second wife. She took care of the injured Huang Xing after the failure of the Second Guangzhou Uprising and signed the surgical consent form as his wife.

description.zh-cn: 1898年，时任湖广总督张之洞推荐黄兴入武昌两湖书院读书。
description.en: In 1898, Zhang Zhidong, then Viceroy of Huguang, recommended Huang Xing to study at the Lianghu Academy in Wuchang.

description.zh-cn: 1898年，黄兴入武昌两湖书院读书。
description.en: In 1898, Huang Xing entered the Lianghu Academy in Wuchang to study.

description.zh-cn: 1902年，黄兴赴日本留学，入东京弘文学院师范科学习。
description.en: In 1902, Huang Xing went to study in Japan and enrolled in the teacher training course at Kōbun Gakuin in Tokyo.

description.zh-cn: 1904年2月15日，黄兴在长沙创立华兴会，并被公推为会长。
description.en: On February 15, 1904, Huang Xing founded the Huaxing Society in Changsha and was elected its president.

description.zh-cn: 1905年，黄兴拥护孙中山，将华兴会与兴中会等团体合并，共同组建了中国同盟会。
description.en: In 1905, Huang Xing supported Sun Yat-sen and merged the Huaxing Society with the Xingzhonghui and other groups to jointly establish the Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 1905年，孙中山联合华兴会、光复会等团体，将兴中会改组并合并成立中国同盟会，被公推为总理。
description.en: In 1905, Sun Yat-sen united groups like the Huaxing Society and Guangfuhui, reorganizing and merging the Xingzhonghui to establish the Tongmenghui, and was elected its Premier.

description.zh-cn: 1905年，孙中山所建立的兴中会与黄兴建立的华兴会等团体合并成立中国同盟会。
description.en: In 1905, the Xingzhonghui, founded by Sun Yat-sen, merged with the Huaxing Society, founded by Huang Xing, and other groups to form the Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 1905年，黄兴所建立的华兴会与孙中山建立的兴中会等团体合并成立中国同盟会。
description.en: In 1905, the Huaxing Society, founded by Huang Xing, merged with the Xingzhonghui, founded by Sun Yat-sen, and other groups to form the Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 光复会是1905年合并成立中国同盟会的革命团体之一。
description.en: The Guangfuhui was one of the revolutionary groups that merged to form the Tongmenghui in 1905.

description.zh-cn: 1907年，因潮州起义失败，光复会成员要求罢免孙中山，最终光复会退出了中国同盟会。
description.en: In 1907, following the failure of the Chaozhou Uprising, members of the Guangfuhui demanded the removal of Sun Yat-sen, which ultimately led to the withdrawal of the Guangfuhui from the Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 陶成章等人以潮州起义失败为由，要求罢免孙中山的总理职务。1909年，陶成章等再次起草《孙文罪状》，对孙中山发难。
description.en: Tao Chengzhang and others, citing the failure of the Chaozhou Uprising, demanded the removal of Sun Yat-sen from his position as Premier. In 1909, Tao and others drafted the 'Indictment of Sun Yat-sen,' launching another attack on him.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴担任黄花岗起义副总指挥，并亲自率领敢死队进攻两广总督府，在战斗中负伤断指。
description.en: Huang Xing served as the deputy commander-in-chief of the Second Guangzhou Uprising, personally leading the dare-to-die squad in an attack on the Viceroy's office, where he was wounded and lost two fingers.

description.zh-cn: 武昌起义爆发后，黄兴于10月28日到达汉口，被推为中华民国军政府战时总司令，指挥革命军作战。
description.en: After the Wuchang Uprising broke out, Huang Xing arrived in Hankou on October 28 and was appointed wartime commander-in-chief of the Military Government of the Republic of China, leading the revolutionary forces in battle.

position.en: Commander-in-Chief of the Jiangsu Anti-Yuan Army

description.zh-cn: 黄兴响应孙中山号召，发动二次革命，在南京被任命为江苏讨袁军总司令，领导讨袁军事行动。
description.en: Responding to Sun Yat-sen's call, Huang Xing launched the Second Revolution and was appointed Commander-in-Chief of the Jiangsu Anti-Yuan Army in Nanjing, leading military operations against Yuan.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴与孙中山长期紧密合作，并称“孙黄”。在多次“倒孙”风波中，黄兴始终坚定支持孙中山，并表示“领袖惟有孙中山”。
description.en: Huang Xing and Sun Yat-sen collaborated closely for a long time and were known as 'Sun-Huang'. During several 'anti-Sun' crises, Huang Xing consistently and firmly supported Sun Yat-sen, stating, 'The only leader is Sun Yat-sen.'

description.zh-cn: 宋教仁案后，黄兴参与发动“二次革命”武力讨伐袁世凯。革命失败后流亡海外，继续宣传反袁思想。
description.en: After the assassination of Song Jiaoren, Huang Xing participated in launching the 'Second Revolution' to militarily oppose Yuan Shikai. After the revolution failed, he went into exile and continued to promote anti-Yuan ideas.

description.zh-cn: 陈其美派遣蒋介石执行了对光复会领袖陶成章的刺杀。
description.en: Chen Qimei dispatched Chiang Kai-shek to carry out the assassination of Guangfuhui leader Tao Chengzhang.

description.zh-cn: 在陈其美的派遣下，蒋介石作为杀手在上海广慈医院刺杀了陶成章。
description.en: Under the orders of Chen Qimei, Chiang Kai-shek acted as the assassin and killed Tao Chengzhang at Guangci Hospital in Shanghai.

description.zh-cn: 陶成章在上海广慈医院被刺杀身亡。
description.en: Tao Chengzhang was assassinated and died at Guangci Hospital in Shanghai.

description.zh-cn: 黄兴与蔡锷是同乡和友人。黄兴逝世时，蔡锷为其写下挽联，不久后两人同葬于岳麓山。
description.en: Huang Xing and Cai E were fellow townsmen and friends. When Huang Xing passed away, Cai E wrote a funeral couplet for him. Shortly after, both were buried on Yuelu Mountain.

description.zh-cn: 武昌起义后，黄兴抵达汉口，被推为中华民国军政府战时总司令。
description.en: After the Wuchang Uprising, Huang Xing arrived in Hankou and was appointed as the Wartime Commander-in-Chief of the Military Government of the Republic of China.
